docs.lead_paragraph: There was a lot of talk on Monday about stem cells. Today let's talk about cord blood, a source of stem cells, taken from the umbilical cord of a newborn immediately after birth. It doesn't hurt the baby - they are not even attached to the cord any longer when the blood is taken - and it could be potentially life saving for someone else down the road, should those cells be a match for someone being treated for blood disease that requires a stem cell transplant.

headline.main: Is Banked Cord Blood Worth It?

docs.abstract: Weighing the cost of keep cord blood on ice - against the possibility that you will ever need it.
docs.snippet: Weighing the cost of keep cord blood on ice - against the possibility that you will ever need it.

docs.lead_paragraph: “Though the public house has long been central to Ireland’s social life, it has never received the sort of scholarly attention it deserves ...”

docs.lead_paragraph: How could any parent forget their child in a sweltering car?

headline.main: Who Forgets a Child in a Car?

docs.abstract: In any given year, between 15 and 25 children will die of hyperthermia - essentially baking in their carseats. A story in the Washington Post magazine asks the question: "why"?
docs.snippet: In any given year, between 15 and 25 children will die of hyperthermia - essentially baking in their carseats. A story in the Washington Post magazine asks the question: "why"?

docs.lead_paragraph: You may need a car, but do you need to own one — or even lease one? Zipcar and a fleet of new competitors are betting that your budget and your green conscience are ready to cooperate.
docs.snippet: You may need a car, but do you need to own one — or even lease one? Zipcar and a fleet of new competitors are betting that your budget and your green conscience are ready to cooperate.
